page.title: 05Nettlecombe Court
page.content: The earliest part of the house was built in the 13th Century. The house was then added on to in the 17th Century. The{Great Hall}which is now the dining room was built in the 16th Century. The West Wing was added in the 18th Century and the last building was carried out in the 19th Century. Nettlecombe Court was a family home for the{Raleigh}family. The Raleigh family were succeeded by the {Treveylan}family and it is now owned by the{Wolsely}family It is a lovely old building set at the bottom of a long valley on the edge of the Brendon Hills. It has been{landscaped}at sometime in the past and there are some magnificent trees in the surrounding parkland.
